{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3288255,"name":"","username":"manso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e99b99/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T21:08:05.426Z","cooked":"

I very recently saw that CTRE now has a Swerve Project Generator as a part of their Tuner X software.

Reading the documentation, it seems that it requires a pigeon 2.0 which our team does not have, however we do have NavX’s (as per the title), I am wondering if there is any way possible to use a NavX instead of a pigeon?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-01-18T21:08:05.426Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":211,"reads":231,"readers_count":230,"score":1096.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":450863,"topic_slug":"can-i-use-a-navx-instead-of-pigeon-2-for-ctre-swerve-project-generator","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://pro.docs.ctr-electronics.com/en/latest/docs/tuner/tuner-swerve/index.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Swerve Project Generator","clicks":20}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6593 Alumni/Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/can-i-use-a-navx-instead-of-pigeon-2-for-ctre-swerve-project-generator/450863/1","custom_user_title":"6593 Alumni/Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3288303,"name":"kylelanman","username":"kylelanman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kylelanman/{size}/3427_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T21:44:40.660Z","cooked":"

No, the built-in latency compensation won’t work unless it is a Pigeon on a CANivore.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-01-18T21:44:40.660Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":222,"readers_count":221,"score":64.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":450863,"topic_slug":"can-i-use-a-navx-instead-of-pigeon-2-for-ctre-swerve-project-generator","display_username":"kylelanman","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9953,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-i-use-a-navx-instead-of-pigeon-2-for-ctre-swerve-project-generator/450863/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3288424,"name":"Benjamin Hall","username":"bhall-ctre","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T23:53:02.024Z","cooked":"
kylelanman:

Pigeon on a CANivore

Note that our Swerve API does not require the use of a CANivore, you just won’t get the benefits of timesync (requires Pro) and 250 Hz odometry without it. With that said, we do require all devices to be Phoenix 6 devices.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-01-18T23:53:02.024Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":193,"readers_count":192,"score":48.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":450863,"topic_slug":"can-i-use-a-navx-instead-of-pigeon-2-for-ctre-swerve-project-generator","display_username":"Benjamin Hall","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":48146,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics"},"post_url":"/t/can-i-use-a-navx-instead-of-pigeon-2-for-ctre-swerve-project-generator/450863/3","custom_user_title":"Software Engineering Intern at CTR Electronics","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3329443,"name":"Tio","username":"Tio","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/d2c977/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T00:10:35.120Z","cooked":"

Any advice on the pigeon placement on robot?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T00:10:35.120Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":116,"readers_count":115,"score":43.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":450863,"topic_slug":"can-i-use-a-navx-instead-of-pigeon-2-for-ctre-swerve-project-generator","display_username":"Tio","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":48146,"username":"bhall-ctre","name":"Benjamin Hall","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bhall-ctre/{size}/198180_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":28847,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-i-use-a-navx-instead-of-pigeon-2-for-ctre-swerve-project-generator/450863/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3329445,"name":"","username":"manso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e99b99/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-11T00:12:33.975Z","cooked":"

I’ve seen most teams put the pigeon (or NavX/other gyro) as close to the center as possible.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2024-03-11T00:12:33.975Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":113,"readers_count":112,"score":22.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":450863,"topic_slug":"can-i-use-a-navx-instead-of-pigeon-2-for-ctre-swerve-project-generator","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":28847,"username":"Tio","name":"Tio","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/d2c977/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55649,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6593 Alumni/Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/can-i-use-a-navx-instead-of-pigeon-2-for-ctre-swerve-project-generator/450863/5","custom_user_title":"6593 Alumni/Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3331202,"name":"Andy Gasser","username":"gdefender","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gdefender/{size}/168507_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-12T16:05:43.959Z","cooked":"

It’s best to keep is as close to the center of rotation as possible to avoid sensor saturation. From the user guide:

Due to the fusion between the accelerometer and the gyroscope, excessive and sustained g-force caused by centripetal acceleration can impact the Yaw. This can be resolved by moving the IMU closer to the COR (center of rotation).
